articleContent.title: Chord: Major 7th in D# (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
# Major 7th Chord in D# (Shape: A)

## Brief Presentation
The Major 7th chord in D# (Shape: A) is a harmonic combination of notes that includes the root note D#, major third F##, perfect fifth A#, and major seventh C##. This chord has a lush and sophisticated sound due to the inclusion of the major 7th interval and is commonly used in jazz, R&B, and other genres to evoke a sense of smoothness and sophistication.

## Notes and Intervals
- Root: D#
- Major Third: F##
- Perfect Fifth: A#
- Major Seventh: C##

## Musical Flavor
The Major 7th chord in D# (Shape: A) has a dreamy and ethereal tonality that can add a sense of elegance and introspection to music. It is often used in more complex and harmonically rich compositions to create a sense of depth and sophistication.

## Songs
1. **"So What" by Miles Davis** - This jazz classic features the Major 7th chord prominently in its chord progression, adding to the cool and laid-back atmosphere of the piece.
   
2. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones** - In this popular song, the Major 7th chord in D# (Shape: A) is used to create a mellow and melancholic mood that complements Norah Jones' soulful vocals.
   
3. **"September" by Earth, Wind & Fire** - This funk and disco hit incorporates the Major 7th chord to add a sophisticated and jazzy flavor to its infectious groove.
